metadata.title: CVE-2020-0423 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In binder_release_work of binder.c, there is a possible use-after-free dueto improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege inthe kernel with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: AndroidkernelAndroid ID: A-161151868References: N/A

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0423` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-129-generic - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-4.15.0-129-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-4.15.0-129-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-129-generic - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-129-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-129.132').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1').
